Salt Lake City School District
February 26 at 11:02 AM ·

ICYMI, this Friday, February 28, 2020, is a half-day for all of our schools. The Salt Lake Education Association (our district’s teachers’ association) has declared a Day of Action. Teachers will be holding a walk-out in the afternoon to encourage the Utah Legislature to prioritize public education funding.

In the Salt Lake City School District (SLCSD), our highest priority is the education and safety of your students. With so many teachers anticipated to participate in the walk-out, we will not have the capacity to provide adequate supervision to keep your students safe and learning that afternoon. Accordingly, we need to implement a half-day schedule on Friday, February 28, for all SLCSD schools.

You can find your school's dismissal time and more information on our website - https://www.slcschools.org/news/2019-20/school-schedules-on-february-28/.

This year, the 6-8th grade classes at the Open Classroom - Salt Lake City have been identifying and addressing the impact of human migration on immigrants, refugees, and the communities they join with an emphasis on how they survive and thrive.
